case_address_found_1: Derby Pond, 2.5 miles south of Camden, Delaware, on U.S.13A
case_circumstances: Three teen age boys, aged 13, 14, and 15 years, were skateboarding on a cement boat ramp on Derby Pond on November 8, 1988, at approximately 3:30 - 3:40 p.m. One of them saw what he thought was a doll wrapped in newspaper, approximately 8 feet from the edge of the pond. One of the boys used a branch to pull it toward the shore. When they looked closely, they saw that it was a baby.
case_eye_description: Each pupil measures 0.3 cm in diameter and is round and regular. The irides are brown. The conjunctiva is pale.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_other_items_with_body: Wrapped in a newspaper dated around September 15, 1988.
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
